resources</topcClas>         <topcClas>Equality and inequality - Social stratification and groupings</topcClas>         <topcClas>Social attitudes and behaviour - Society and culture</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i>Northern Ireland Life and Times Survey</i> (NILT) series began in 1998, and was the successor to the previous <i>Northern Ireland Social Attitudes</i> series, (held at the UK Data Archive under SN 33235), which was discontinued in 1996. The aims of the NILT series are:<ul><li>to monitor public attitudes towards social policy and political issues in Northern Ireland</li><li>to provide a time series on attitudes to key social policy areas</li><li>to facilitate academic social policy analysis</li><li>to provide a freely available resource on public attitudes for the wider community of users in Northern Ireland</li></ul>NILT originally had a companion series which also began in 1998, the <i>Young Life and Times Survey</i> (YLT) (see under SN 33313), although the YLT methodology changed in 2003. NILT also forms part of the <a href="http://www.issp.org/" title ="International Social Survey Programme">International Social Survey Programme</a> (ISSP), although it does not do so every year. Unfortunately, the NILT team were unable to obtain full funding to run NILT in 2011, though YLT ran as normal that year. NILT resumed in 2012 - see SN 7408. In addition, two open access teaching datasets were created from NILT 2012, one covering Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual and Transgender (LGBT) issues and the other covering  politics and good relations (see SNs 7546 and 7547 respectively).<br> <br> Further information about the NILT series may be found on the ARK (Access Research Knowledge) <a href="http://www.ark.ac.uk/nilt/" title="NILT">NILT</a> webpages.<br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract>The <I>Northern Ireland Life and Times Survey, 2012: Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual and Transgender Issues Teaching Dataset</I> is part of a suite of teaching and learning resources created as part of a Higher Education Academy (HEA) strategic project focusing on teaching research methods.  The project <a href="https://www.heacademy.ac.uk/disciplines/Soc_Sci/TRM_ProjectReports_2012-13-1" title="Learning by numbers: new open educational resources for teaching quantitative methods">Learning by numbers: new open educational resources for teaching quantitative methods</a> involved the creation of new teaching datasets from two major surveys focusing on Northern Ireland, with accompanying 'student-friendly' documentation and teaching guidelines. Specifically, two teaching datasets were created using NILT 2012 (see also SN 7547, which covers politics and good relations) as well as a time-series teaching dataset drawing on the 2003-2012 <I>Young Life and Times</I> (YLT) surveys (see SN 7548). Documentation combining an edited technical report and codebook accompanies the teaching datasets. This documentation includes details of all the variables included in the teaching datasets as well as a summary technical report, with the main issues outlines in accessible language, for example, research design, sampling and response rates. Teaching guidelines drawing upon the particular variables included in the datasets are also available.  <br> <br> This dataset focuses on public attitudes to Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual and Transgender (LGBT) issues in Northern Ireland. It is based on NILT 2012, and adapted for the purposes of this project. Some variables have been constructed and/or simplified for this teaching dataset \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd notes are provided in the codebook.  While the teaching datasets contains the same total number of respondents, they are intended for teaching purposes only; it is advisable to use the original NILT 2012 study (see SN 7408) for research. Further information about the teaching datasets may be found on the <a href="http://www.ark.ac.uk/teaching/teachqm.html" title="ARK Teaching datasets: Learning by numbers">ARK Teaching datasets: Learning by numbers</a> webpage.<br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The topics covered include public attitudes to Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual and Transgender (LGBT) issues in Northern Ireland, and some demographic details.<br> </abstract>       <sumDscr>         <collDate event="start" date="2012-10-01T00:00:00Z">October 2012</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="2013-01-01T00:00:00Z">January 2013</collDate>         <nation>Northern Ireland</nation>         <geogUnit>No spatial unit</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Northern Irish adults</universe>         <universe>Adults aged 18 or over, living in private households in Northern Ireland during 2012.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Repeated cross-sectional study</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>The NILT 2012 teaching datasets were created as part of a single project.</timeMeth>         <dataCollector>Perceptive Insight</dataCollector>         <sampProc>One-stage stratified or systematic random sample</sampProc>         <deviat>1,204 individuals</deviat>         <collMode>Compilation or synthesis of existing material</collMode>         <collMode>Face-to-face interview; Self-completion</collMode>         <collMode>The teaching dataset is a simplified subset created from NILT 2012; see documentation for details.</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>Weighting used. See documentation for details.</weight>         <cleanOps>A*</cleanOps>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>
